Description: Body sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery krater or dinos; exterior, dull cream slip: part of two friezes separated by broad black band; above, male figures (left leg of one figure and right leg of second figure remaining), running or dancing to right; below, possible bird's wing with added white dots.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd is published in CVA Cambridge II as having a Clazomenian origin.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 39, no. 15, pl. XIX, no. 15)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 140, c)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.566)
